meanings.definition: The quality or state of being uncouth or boorish.
meanings.sent1: His loutishness was evident in the way he spoke with his mouth full.
meanings.sent2: Her loutishness at the dinner table embarrassed her family.
meanings.sent3: The loutishness of the clown at the party made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The loutishness of the storm left a trail of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The loutishness of the bear startled the hikers in the woods.

meanings.sent1: The loutishness of his actions was unacceptable in a public setting.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand his loutishness when he refused to help clean up.
meanings.sent3: The loutishness of the dog chasing its tail was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The loutishness of the old car made it stand out among the sleek new models.
meanings.sent5: His loutishness in the classroom disrupted the other students' learning.
